compositeCheatsheet.name: Importing logical tables from SAP with Rapid Modeler

taskGroup.name: Importing logical tables from SAP with Rapid Modeler
taskGroup.intro: This cheat sheet will guide you through the process of importing logical tables from SAP into a logical data model. In particular, it will guide you through the creation of all required artifacts.
taskGroup.onCompletion: You have now created a logical data model containing SAP metadata, a database that can hold SAP data, and jobs that are able to extract data from SAP to this database.

task.name: Defining connections to an SAP system
task.intro: This task shows to to define connections to SAP systems.

task.name: Creating an ABAP Table List
task.intro: An ABAP Table list defines which ABAP tables (a.k.a. logical tables) should be imported.

task.name: Creating a Rapid Modeler Configuration
task.intro: A Rapid Modeler configuration defines how SAP objects should be imported.

task.name: Running the Rapid Modeler wizard
task.intro: The Rapid Modeler wizard performs the actual import using all artifacts created before.

task.name: Using the new SAP Packs views
task.intro: Use new views to get your workspace organized.
